recipes.name: Roast Chicken with Rosemary-Orange Butter
ingredients: 1 (7-pound) whole roasting chicken, neck and giblets reserved
Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Position a rack in the center of the oven.
Step 2: Prepare the rosemary-orange butter: In a small bowl, combine 1 minced shallot, softened butter, minced rosemary, and orange zest. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
Step 3: Prepare the chicken: Pat the chicken dry with paper towels. Using your fingers, gently loosen the skin from the chicken breasts, legs, and thighs.
Step 4: Season the chicken cavity with salt and pepper.
Step 5: Spread half of the rosemary-orange butter under the loosened skin of the chicken.
Step 6: Tie the chicken legs together with kitchen twine to hold its shape.
Step 7: Spread the remaining rosemary-orange butter over the outside of the chicken. Season generously with salt and pepper.

Step 8: Prepare the roasting pan: Place a rack in a large roasting pan. Add the reserved chicken neck and giblets, chopped onion, carrots, and celery to the pan. Chop the remaining 2 shallots and add them to the pan as well.

Step 9: Roast the chicken: Place the chicken, breast side up, on the rack in the roasting pan. Roast for about 1 hour and 40 minutes, or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh registers 180°F (82°C). Stir the vegetables in the pan occasionally during roasting.
Step 10: Make the pan sauce: Transfer the roasted chicken to a platter and tent loosely with foil to rest. Do not clean the roasting pan.
Step 11: Place the roasting pan over medium-high heat. Add the white wine and simmer until most of it evaporates, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan, about 5 minutes.
Step 12: Add the chicken broth to the pan and simmer until the sauce is reduced to about 1 1/2 cups, stirring often, about 6 minutes.
Step 13: Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve into a 2-cup glass measuring cup or bowl. Discard the solids.
Step 14: Skim off any excess fat from the surface of the sauce.
Step 15: Season the sauce to taste with salt and pepper.
Step 16: Carve the chicken and serve with the pan sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a roast chicken glistening with rosemary-orange butter, its skin golden brown and crispy.  Focus on the carved breast, revealing juicy meat.  Style the chicken on a rustic wooden board, scattered with roasted carrots, shallots, and sprigs of fresh rosemary. Include a small copper pot of pan jus in the background.  Use warm, natural light, creating a shallow depth of field to highlight the chicken's texture. The mood should be inviting, rustic, and appetizing.  A slightly overhead, three-quarters angle will best showcase the dish.

recipes.name: Classic Butter Chicken
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, lime juice, salt, and red chili powder. Marinate for at least 1 hour, or up to 2 hours, in the refrigerator.

Step 2: In a dry skillet over medium heat, lightly toast the cloves, peppercorns, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and almonds until fragrant and slightly darkened. Let cool, then add the cardamom seeds. Grind the toasted spices into a coarse powder using a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.

Step 3: In a separate bowl, whisk together the yogurt, ground spice mixture, coriander, cumin, and turmeric. Add this mixture to the marinated chicken, ensuring it's well coated. Marinate for another hour in the refrigerator.

Step 4: Heat the vegetable oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add the garlic and ginger pastes and cook for another minute until fragrant.

Step 5: Add the marinated chicken to the pot and cook until the chicken turns opaque. Add the pureed tomatoes, chicken stock, and kasuri methi. Bring to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Step 6: In a small pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Pour the melted butter over the cooked chicken. Stir gently to combine.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

The rich orange sauce should glisten under soft, directional lighting, highlighting the tender chicken pieces and fresh cilantro garnish. Include a wedge of lime and a naan bread partially torn, revealing its fluffy interior, to complete the composition. The overall mood should be warm, inviting, and appetizing.

recipes.name: Grilled Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 (3-4 pound) whole chicken, quartered, skin removed
1/2 cup melted butter or ghee (clarified butter)
directions: Step 1: Place the quartered, skinless chicken in a shallow glass dish.
Step 2: In a bowl, combine the pureed onion, plain yogurt, minced garlic, minced serrano chile, ground ginger, ground coriander seed, oil, and salt.
Step 3: Pour the mixture over the chicken. Cover the dish and marinate in the refrigerator for 8-12 hours.
Step 4: Remove the chicken from the refrigerator and let it stand at room temperature for 20-30 minutes.
Step 5: Meanwhile, melt the butter or ghee in a saucepan over medium heat for 3-5 minutes.
Step 6: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Step 7: Place the chicken on a lightly oiled grill rack. Grill for 35-45 minutes, turning and basting frequently with the melted butter or ghee.
Step 8: Remove the chicken from the grill when it is fully cooked (internal temperature of 165°F/74°C). Serve immediately with the remaining melted butter or ghee drizzled on top.

Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, with soft, directional light highlighting the textures. The mood should be warm and inviting, emphasizing the rich, savory flavors. recipes.name: Creamy Butter Chicken with Roasted Cauliflower
ingredients: 2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
1/2 cup fresh cilantro, chopped (for serving, optional)
1/4 cup heavy whipping cream (for serving, optional)
1 pound cauliflower, cut into bite-sized florets
directions: Step 1: Combine the chopped tomato, chopped onion, minced ginger, minced garlic, tomato paste, garam masala, chili powder, and salt in a food processor. Process until smooth. Add 3/4 cup heavy cream and pulse for a few seconds to combine.

Step 2: Place the chicken pieces in a bowl or resealable bag. Pour the marinade over the chicken, ensuring it's fully coated. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes, or preferably longer (up to 4 hours).
Step 3: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

Step 4: Spread the cauliflower florets in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of melted butter and season with turmeric, coriander seeds, and black pepper. Toss to coat evenly. Roast for 15-20 minutes, or until tender and slightly browned.

Step 5: While the cauliflower is roasting, heat 1 2/3 ounces of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade, reserving the marinade. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, until lightly browned.

Step 6: Pour the reserved marinade into the skillet with the chicken. Add the remaining butter. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Step 7: Serve the butter chicken hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and a drizzle of cream (optional). Serve alongside the roasted cauliflower.

The chicken should be nestled amongst golden-brown cauliflower florets, glistening with sauce.  Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the textures and rich orange hue.  Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs.  A rustic wooden surface and a linen napkin should subtly complement the dish.  Shallow depth of field with focus on the chicken and cauliflower, creating a warm, inviting mood.

scenes.text: Creamy Butter Chicken with Roasted Cauliflower
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a delicious and easy Creamy Butter Chicken with Roasted Cauliflower. This dish is packed with flavor and perfect for any occasion.

scenes.image_prompt: Show all ingredients for the recipe neatly arranged on a table. Group related ingredients, such as spices together, produce together, and the chicken and cream separate from the cauliflower and its spices.

For the cauliflower, we have cauliflower florets, turmeric, coriander seeds, and black pepper.  And for garnish, fresh cilantro and extra cream, if desired.

scenes.image_prompt: Tomato, onion, ginger, and garlic being processed in a food processor until smooth. Then, the tomato paste, garam masala, chili powder, salt are added and processed. Finally, heavy cream is pulsed in.
scenes.voice_over: First, combine tomato, onion, ginger, and garlic in a food processor until smooth. Add tomato paste, garam masala, chili powder, and salt. Process, then pulse in heavy cream. This marinade will infuse the chicken with incredible flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken thighs being coated in the marinade in a bowl.  Show the bowl being covered and placed in the refrigerator.
scenes.voice_over: Place the chicken thighs in a bowl and pour the marinade over them.  Make sure every piece is well coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 20 minutes, or up to 4 hours for maximum flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Cauliflower florets being tossed with melted butter, turmeric, coriander seeds, and black pepper on a baking sheet. Show the baking sheet going into the preheated oven.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss cauliflower florets with melted butter, turmeric, coriander seeds, and black pepper. Spread them on a baking sheet and roast for 15-20 minutes, until tender and slightly browned.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken thighs browning in a skillet with butter over medium-high heat. Show the chicken being turned to ensure even browning.
scenes.voice_over: While the cauliflower roasts, heat butter in a skillet.  Remove chicken from the marinade (reserve the marinade!) and sear for 5-7 minutes until lightly browned.

scenes.image_prompt: Reserved marinade being poured into the skillet with the browned chicken. The remaining butter is also added. The mixture is brought to a simmer, then the heat is reduced to allow the sauce to thicken.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the reserved marinade into the skillet, add the remaining butter, and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and cook for 15-20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened beautifully.

scenes.image_prompt: Final plated dish of Creamy Butter Chicken alongside the Roasted Cauliflower, garnished with fresh cilantro and a drizzle of cream. A serving spoon is placed next to the butter chicken.
scenes.voice_over: Serve the butter chicken hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and a drizzle of cream, if desired. Serve with the delicious roasted cauliflower. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use bone-in chicken thighs. Adjust the cooking time accordingly.
If the sauce is too thick, add a splash of chicken broth or water to thin it out.
For a spicier dish, add more chili powder or a pinch of cayenne pepper.
Leftovers can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

recipes.name: Spicy Butter Chicken Wings with Butter Chicken Dipping Sauce
ingredients: 2 lbs Chicken wings, wing tips removed
1 (400 ml) jar Patak's Spicy Butter Chicken Cooking Sauce
2 tsp Patak's Butter Chicken Curry Paste
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 450°F (232°C). Grease a baking sheet.
Step 2: Arrange chicken wings in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. Turn the wings over and bake for an additional 20 minutes, or until golden brown and cooked through.

Step 3: While the chicken wings are baking, prepare the Butter Chicken Dipping Sauce: In a small bowl, combine the sour cream and Patak's Butter Chicken Curry Paste. Stir until well blended. Set aside.
Step 4: In a medium saucepan, heat the Patak's Spicy Butter Chicken Cooking Sauce over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until heated through.
Step 5: Add the cooked chicken wings to the saucepan with the heated sauce and toss to coat evenly.
Step 6: Transfer the coated chicken wings to a serving platter. Sprinkle with chopped fresh cilantro. Serve immediately with the prepared Butter Chicken Dipping Sauce.

A small bowl of creamy butter chicken dipping sauce, garnished with fresh cilantro, sits beside them. Use a shallow depth of field, focusing on the wings in the foreground.  Warm, inviting lighting should highlight the vibrant orange hue and textures. Incorporate dark, moody background elements and a slightly overhead, angled shot to showcase the dish's appeal.

ingredients: 1/3 cup plain non-fat yogurt + 2 tablespoons water

1 teaspoon ground cumin (from dry roasted cumin seeds)
1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 2-3 inch cubes
2-3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, for garnish
1/2 cup thinly sliced red onion (from 1/2 medium red onion)
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a food processor, combine all the ingredients for the marinade (yogurt, 1 teaspoon garam masala, ginger, garlic, red pepper powder, cumin, and salt) except for 2 tablespoons of yogurt and 1/2 teaspoon of garam masala. Blend until smooth. If the mixture is too thick, add 1 tablespoon of water.

recipes.name: Ultimate Baked Chicken
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Rinse the chicken and pat it dry. Place it in a roasting pan or a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Step 3: In a microwave-safe bowl or small saucepan, combine Italian dressing, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and butter. Heat until the butter is melted and the mixture is well combined.
Step 4: Pour the marinade over the chicken, ensuring it's coated thoroughly, inside and out.
Step 5: Sprinkle the top and sides of the chicken with poultry seasoning, salt, pepper, basil, and garlic powder.
Step 6: Place the bay leaves inside the chicken cavity.
Step 7: Bake for 30 minutes, then baste the chicken with pan juices.
Step 8: Bake for another 30 minutes.
Step 9: Remove the chicken from the oven and turn it over.
Step 10: Baste the exposed underside with pan juices and season with additional poultry seasoning, pepper, and basil.
Step 11: Return the chicken to the oven and bake for another 30 minutes.
Step 12: Turn the chicken over again and continue baking for 15-30 minutes, or until the juices run clear when the thickest part of the thigh is pierced with a fork.
Step 13: Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving.

recipes.name: Classic Chicken Kiev
ingredients: 3 large or 4 medium eggs, slightly beaten
Black pepper or cayenne pepper, to taste
150 grams slightly salted butter, for garlic butter
1 cup fresh dill or parsley, chopped
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Garlic Herb Butter: In a food processor, combine butter, minced garlic, chopped herbs, lemon juice, and black pepper. Process until smooth.
Step 2: Shape and Chill Butter: Form the butter mixture into a log about 1.5 inches thick. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap and freeze for at least 20 minutes.

Step 3: Prepare the Chicken: Trim any excess fat from the chicken breasts. Place each breast between two sheets of plastic wrap and pound to an even thickness of about 0.2 inches. Be careful not to tear the chicken.
Step 4: Marinate Chicken: Season the pounded chicken breasts with the chicken spice mix and let marinate for 10-15 minutes.
Step 5: Assemble the Chicken Kiev: Cut the chilled garlic herb butter into 6 equal pieces. Place one piece of butter in the center of each chicken breast.
Step 6: Roll and Seal: Fold the chicken over the butter, sealing the edges tightly. Wrap each Kiev tightly in plastic wrap and freeze for at least 1 hour.

Step 7: Bread the Kievs: Set up three shallow dishes: one with corn flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with bread crumbs. Remove the Chicken Kievs from the freezer and unwrap. Dredge each Kiev in corn flour, then dip in the egg, and finally coat thoroughly with bread crumbs.
Step 8: Fry the Kievs: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the breaded Kievs for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through.

Step 9: Bake (Optional): For extra assurance that the chicken is cooked through and the butter is melted, transfer the fried Kievs to a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) for 15-20 minutes.
Step 10: Serve: Serve the Chicken Kiev immediately with mashed potatoes, a side salad, or your favorite vegetables.

recipes.name: Classic Butter Chicken
ingredients: 2 lbs boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces
Whole wheat Stonefire naan, for serving
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the chicken, Greek yogurt, lemon juice, turmeric, garam masala, cumin, and cayenne pepper. Marinate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight, in the refrigerator.

Step 2: In a large skillet or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened and translucent, about 5-7 minutes. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more.

Step 3: Add the diced tomatoes (undrained) to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the marinated chicken and its marinade to the pan and cook for another 5 minutes, until the chicken is lightly browned.
Step 4: Pour in the chicken stock and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 5: Stir in the heavy cream and tomato paste. Continue to simmer, uncovered, for 15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened to your desired consistency.
Step 6: Season with salt and additional lemon juice, to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with whole wheat Stonefire naan.

recipes.name: Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken)
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-size pieces
Salt and black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: Begin cooking the white rice according to package directions.
Step 2: Heat the vegetable oil or canola oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
Step 3: Add the chicken pieces and cook until they begin to brown, stirring occasionally.
Step 4: Add the finely chopped onion and a pinch of salt to the pot. Cook, stirring, until the onion softens, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 5: Add the grated ginger and minced garlic to the pot and cook for 2 minutes more, stirring frequently.
Step 6: Sprinkle the garam masala, chili powder, ground cumin, and ground red pepper over the chicken and onion mixture. Stir continuously for 2 minutes to toast the spices.
Step 7: Stir in the tomato sauce, sour cream or evaporated milk, butter or Butter Buds, lemon juice, and bay leaf. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 8: Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Step 9: Remove the bay leaf.
Step 10: Stir the cooked rice into the chicken makhani.
Step 11: Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Step 12: Serve hot, garnished with chopped scallions or cilantro, if desired.

recipes.name: Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken)
ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Sauté the shallot and onion until softened and translucent.
Step 2: Add the butter, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon of garam masala, chili powder, cumin, and bay leaf. Cook and stir for 1 minute.
Step 3: Add the tomato puree and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Step 4: Stir in the half-and-half and yogurt. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently.
Step 5: Season with salt, pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper. Remove from heat and set aside.
Step 6: Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of peanut oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken until lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
Step 7: Reduce the heat and season the chicken with 1 teaspoon of garam masala and 1/8 teaspoon of cayenne pepper.
Step 8: Stir in about 1/3 of the sauce and simmer until the liquid has reduced and the chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes.
Step 9: Pour the rest of the sauce into the skillet with the chicken.
Step 10: In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water until smooth. Stir the cornstarch mixture into the sauce.
Step 11: Cook for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.

video_script.title: Creamy Dreamy Chicken Makhani (Indian Butter Chicken)

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished Chicken Makhani dish, garnished with fresh cilantro, served with basmati rice and naan bread.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making Chicken Makhani, a creamy and flavorful Indian classic. It's surprisingly easy to make at home.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients laid out on a table: Chicken thighs, shallot, onion, ginger-garlic paste, yogurt, half-and-half, tomato puree.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: boneless, skinless chicken thighs, shallot, onion, ginger-garlic paste, plain yogurt, half-and-half, and tomato puree.  We'll also be using some common spices and pantry staples like butter, lemon juice, and oil.

scenes.image_prompt: Saucepan with oil, sautéing shallots and onions.
scenes.voice_over: Heat one tablespoon of peanut oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Sauté the chopped shallot and onion until softened, about 5 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Adding butter, spices, and ginger-garlic paste to the saucepan.
scenes.voice_over: Add butter, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, chili powder, cumin, and a bay leaf. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly, until fragrant.

scenes.image_prompt: Adding tomato puree and cooking, then stirring in yogurt and half-and-half.
scenes.voice_over: Add the tomato puree and cook for 2 minutes. Now, stir in the half-and-half and yogurt. Reduce heat to low, simmer for 10 minutes, and stir frequently. This creates the creamy base of our Makhani.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken browning in a skillet.
scenes.voice_over: In a skillet, heat the remaining peanut oil over medium heat. Cook the chicken thighs until lightly browned, about 8-10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Adding some of the sauce to the chicken and simmering.
scenes.voice_over: Season the chicken with garam masala and cayenne pepper. Add about 1/3 of the sauce to the skillet and simmer for 5 minutes, allowing the chicken to absorb the flavors.

scenes.image_prompt: Pouring remaining sauce into the skillet, thickening with cornstarch slurry.
scenes.voice_over: Pour in the remaining sauce. In a small bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water, then stir this mixture into the sauce. Cook for 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce reaches your desired consistency.

scenes.image_prompt: Final shot of Chicken Makhani served with rice or naan, garnished with cilantro.
scenes.voice_over: Your Chicken Makhani is ready! Serve hot with basmati rice or naan bread. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use ghee instead of peanut oil.

Adjust the amount of cayenne pepper to your preferred level of spiciness.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and a dollop of yogurt or cream before serving.

recipes.name: Indian Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 2-inch cubes
2 tablespoons ginger-garlic paste (or 1-inch piece ginger, grated, and 4 cloves garlic, minced)
1/3 cup plain yogurt, whisked until smooth
1 small red onion, thinly sliced into half-moons
directions: Step 1: In a large bowl, combine the ginger-garlic paste, diced tomatoes, tomato paste, ground almonds, salt, garam masala, cayenne pepper (or chili powder), ground cumin, and ground cardamom (if using).
Step 2: Add the whisked yogurt to the spice mixture and mix well.
Step 3: Add the cubed chicken thighs to the marinade and coat thoroughly. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably longer.
Step 4: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 5: Melt the butter in a large oven-safe skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the sliced red onions and sauté until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes.
Step 6: Add the marinated chicken to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, lightly browning on all sides.
Step 7:  If using cardamom pods, add them to the skillet now. Stir in the heavy cream and cilantro (if using).
Step 8: Cover the skillet and bake for 25 minutes. Then, uncover and bake for another 5 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and nicely browned on top.
Step 9: Optionally, broil the chicken for 1-2 minutes to further enhance the browning. Serve hot with rice or naan.

Use soft, directional lighting to highlight the creamy texture and rich orange-red hue.  Garnish with fresh cilantro and a swirl of cream.  A dark, textured background and a few scattered cashew nuts will enhance the mood. recipes.name: Lemon-Garlic Butter Chicken Thighs
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Step 2: Melt 3 tablespoons of butter in a microwave-safe bowl. Add the smashed garlic cloves, lemon juice, and onion powder. Stir to combine and set aside.
Step 3: Season chicken thighs generously with salt and pepper.
Step 4: Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken thighs, skin-side down, for 3-4 minutes.
Step 5: Flip the chicken thighs and brush the skin with the lemon-garlic butter mixture. Pour the remaining butter mixture into the skillet and remove from heat.

Step 6: Bake for 30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the juices run clear. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165°F (74°C). Brush the chicken skin with pan juices every 10 minutes during baking.
Step 7: Remove the skillet from the oven and transfer the chicken thighs to a serving platter. Drizzle with pan juices and garnish with fresh parsley.

Melt a pat of butter over the thighs and sprinkle with fresh parsley.  Use soft, natural light from the side to highlight the crispy skin and juicy texture.  Shallow depth of field with focus on the foreground thigh.  Include a wedge of lemon and a sprig of rosemary as props. Background should be slightly darkened and blurred for a moody, intimate feel.

scenes.voice_over: Flip the chicken thighs and brush them generously with the lemon-garlic butter mixture.  Pour the remaining butter mixture into the skillet.

recipes.name: Seven-Layer Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease seven 8-inch cake pans.
3. In a bowl, whisk together the cake flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda. Set aside.
4. In another bowl, combine the milk and sour cream. Set aside.
5. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter, peanut butter, and brown sugar for 4-5 minutes, until light and fluffy.
6. Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract.
7. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, alternating with the milk mixture, beginning and ending with the dry ingredients. Mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
8. Divide the batter evenly among the prepared cake pans, about 1 cup per pan. Spread evenly.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until a wooden skewer inserted into the center comes out clean.
10. Let the cakes cool in the pans for 10 minutes before inverting them onto a wire rack to cool completely.
11. Grind 3 cups of Peanut Butter & Cocoa Pebbles cereal in a food processor until finely ground.
12. In a bowl, sift together the confectioners' sugar and cocoa powder. Add the ground cereal and mix well. Set aside.
13. In a large bowl, beat the softened butter for 3-4 minutes, until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla extract.
14. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the butter, beating until smooth.
15. Add the sour cream and mix well.
16. Grind 1 cup of Peanut Butter & Cocoa Pebbles cereal in a food processor. Set aside the remaining 1 cup of cereal for later use.
17. In a bowl, combine the ground cereal, peanut butter, and confectioners' sugar. Mix well, cover, and freeze for at least 1 hour, or until firm.
18. Once firm, roll the mixture into 1-teaspoon-sized balls. Roll each ball in the remaining cereal crumbs.
19. Freeze the truffles until ready to use.
20. In a heatproof bowl, place the semi-sweet chocolate chips.
21. Heat the heavy cream in the microwave for 30-45 seconds, or until hot but not boiling. Alternatively, heat in a small saucepan over medium heat.
22. Pour the hot heavy cream over the chocolate chips. Let stand for 2 minutes.
23. Gently stir until the chocolate is completely melted and smooth.
24. Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Spread a thin layer of chocolate frosting on top. Repeat with the remaining cake layers.
25. Frost the top and sides of the cake with the remaining chocolate frosting. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to set.
26. Drizzle the warm ganache over the top of the cake, letting it drip down the sides.
27. Decorate with sprinkles and peanut butter truffles around the top and bottom edges of the cake.
28. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

recipes.name: Butter Chicken with Cucumber-Yogurt Raita
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, trimmed and cut into 2cm cubes
400g butternut pumpkin, deseeded and cut into 2cm cubes
1 (495g) jar lite butter chicken simmer sauce (e.g., Chicken Tonight)
1 Lebanese cucumber, halved and finely chopped
directions: Step 1: Heat a deep non-stick frying pan over high heat.
Step 2: Add the chicken and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Step 3: Add the pumpkin and simmer sauce. Bring to a boil.
Step 4: Reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes.
Step 5: While the chicken and pumpkin are simmering, cook the rice in a large saucepan of salted boiling water according to package directions until tender.
Step 6: Drain the cooked rice.
Step 7: In a bowl, combine the yogurt, cucumber, and coriander.
Step 8: Season the yogurt mixture with salt.
Step 9: Serve the chicken and pumpkin mixture over the rice.
Step 10: Top with a dollop of the yogurt mixture.
Step 11: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Butter Chicken
ingredients: 1.5 kg boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 2-inch pieces
3 tablespoons finely chopped peeled ginger root
directions: Step 1: Spray a 4-quart slow cooker with cooking spray.

Step 2: In a 10-inch skillet, heat butter and oil over medium-high heat. Add half of the chicken and cook, turning once, until browned, about 5 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the chicken to the slow cooker. Repeat with the remaining chicken.

Step 3: Reduce heat to medium. Add onions to the skillet and cook until softened, about 4 minutes. Add garlic and ginger root; cook and stir for 2 minutes. Add garam masala and cook for 30 seconds. Add tomato paste and salt; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Step 4: Add chicken broth to the skillet and scrape the bottom with a wooden spoon to loosen any browned bits. Pour the mixture into the slow cooker.
Step 5: Cover and cook on low for 5 to 6 hours. During the last 30 minutes of cooking, stir in heavy whipping cream.
Step 6: Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with cilantro leaves. Serve over rice, if desired.

recipes.name: Murgh Makhani (Moghul Butter Chicken)
ingredients: 800g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 3-4cm pieces
2 cloves garlic, peeled and finely crushed
1 1/2 tablespoons ghee or melted unsalted butter
2 cloves garlic, peeled and finely chopped
1 tablespoon chopped fresh coriander, for garnish
directions: Step 1: In a bowl, combine the chicken thighs, crushed garlic, grated ginger, salt, chili powder, and lemon juice. Mix well, cover with cling film, and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Step 2: In a separate bowl, mix together the yoghurt, garam masala, turmeric, and cumin. Add this mixture to the marinated chicken, ensuring each piece is well coated. Cover again and chill for 3-4 hours.
Step 3: Preheat oven to 180°C/Fan 160°C/Gas 4.
Step 4: Place the marinated chicken pieces on a grill rack set over a baking tray. Bake for 8-10 minutes.
Step 5: Brush the chicken pieces with vegetable oil, turn them over, and bake for another 10-12 minutes, or until cooked through.
Step 6: While the chicken is baking, prepare the sauce. Heat the ghee or butter in a pan. Add the chopped garlic and ginger and fry for about a minute.
Step 7: Add the cardamom seeds, cloves, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, fenugreek, and chili powder. Stir well and fry for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Step 8: Stir in the tomato puree and lemon juice and cook for another 2 minutes.
Step 9: Add the baked chicken pieces to the sauce and stir well to coat.
Step 10: Add the butter and cream, stirring continuously until the butter has melted and the sauce is smooth.
Step 11: Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Step 12: Transfer to a warm serving bowl and garnish with fresh coriander. Serve hot.

recipes.name: Peanut Butter and Jelly Layer Cake
ingredients: 1 Gallon-size Ziploc bag or piping bag with large tip
1/4 cup Freeze-Dried Berries, crushed (such as strawberries)
directions: 1. Prepare the Browned Butter Cake: Place 8 tablespoons of butter in a microwave-safe bowl and cover with a microwave-safe plate. Microwave in 1-minute increments until browned, stirring occasionally. Cool completely.
2. Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a quarter sheet pan with parchment paper.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together cake flour, baking powder, and salt.
4. In a stand mixer, cream together the browned butter, remaining unsalted butter, and sugars until light and fluffy.
5. Beat in eggs one at a time, then beat for 2-3 minutes on medium-high.
6. With the mixer on low, gradually add buttermilk, oil, and vanilla. Beat on medium-high for 5-6 minutes until doubled in size.
7. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients with the mixer on low speed. Mix until just combined.
8. Spread batter evenly in the prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool completely.
9. Prepare the Peanut Butter Frosting: Beat cream cheese and butter until light and fluffy. Add peanut butter and vanilla, and beat until combined.
10. Gradually add powdered sugar and beat until light and fluffy.
11. Prepare the Berry Milk Crumbs: Preheat oven to 250°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
12. Combine 1/2 cup powdered milk, flour, cornstarch, sugar, and salt. Add melted butter and mix until crumbly.
13. Spread crumbs on the prepared sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Cool completely.
14. Crush any large crumbs and combine with remaining powdered milk and crushed berries.
15. Pour melted white chocolate over crumbs and toss until coated. Let harden completely.
16. Assemble the Cake: Mix milk and vanilla extract in a small bowl.
17. Warm jelly briefly in the microwave.
18. Using a 6-inch cake ring, cut two full circles and two half-circles from the cake.
19. Place one cake circle in the ring. Brush with milk mixture, spread with jelly, and sprinkle with crumbs.
20. Pipe a layer of frosting over the crumbs and smooth evenly.
21. Top with the two cake half-circles to create another full layer.
22. Repeat layering with milk mixture, jelly, crumbs, and frosting.
23. Top with the final cake layer, brush with milk mixture, and frost with remaining frosting. Garnish with berry crumbs.
24. Freeze the cake for at least 8 hours before serving.

recipes.name: Pan-Fried Chicken with Lemon-Caper Sauce
ingredients: 8 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves (about 2 lbs)
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Chicken: Using a meat mallet, lightly pound any thicker parts of the chicken breasts to an even thickness.

Step 2: Set Up Breading Stations: In a shallow dish, combine the flour, salt, and pepper. In another shallow dish, combine the bread crumbs, Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, oregano, basil, and cayenne pepper. In a third shallow dish, whisk the eggs.

Step 3: Bread the Chicken: Working with one piece at a time, dredge the chicken in the flour mixture, then dip in the egg, letting excess drip off. Finally, dredge in the bread crumb mixture, pressing gently to adhere.

Step 4: Cook the Chicken: In a large cast-iron skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add 4 breaded chicken breasts and cook for 6-8 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer the cooked chicken to a serving platter and season with kosher salt. Repeat with the remaining chicken breasts.
Step 5: Make the Sauce: Add the minced shallots and capers to the skillet and cook for 30 seconds, stirring frequently. Add the lemon slices and cook for another minute, until heated through.
Step 6: Serve: Spoon the lemon-caper sauce over the chicken and serve immediately. Alternatively, serve the sauce on the side.

recipes.name: Classic Butter Chicken
ingredients: 2 large boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Step 1: Melt the butter in a large skillet or pan over medium heat.
Step 2: Add the chopped onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.

Step 4: In a bowl, combine the ground ginger, chili powder, turmeric, cinnamon, and salt.
Step 5: Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and toss until evenly coated with the spice mixture.
Step 6: Add the spiced chicken to the skillet and sauté until golden brown on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Step 7: Stir in the heavy cream and tomato paste.
Step 8: Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 9: Sprinkle with garam masala and serve hot with rice or naan.

recipes.name: North Indian Butter Chicken
ingredients: 500g boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-1.5 inch pieces
Chopped fresh coriander leaves for garnish
Chopped fresh mint leaves for garnish
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Tomato Puree: Chop the tomatoes and blend them in a food processor until smooth. Set aside.
Step 2: Sauté Spices: In a large pan or pot, melt the butter over medium heat. Add caraway seeds and sauté until fragrant.
Step 3: Add Whole Spices: Add crushed cardamom pods, stone flowers, peppercorns, cloves, and black cardamom. Sauté for 2 minutes.
Step 4: Add Ginger-Garlic Paste and Sugar: Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 2 minutes. Stir in the sugar.

Step 5: Simmer Tomato Puree and Spices: Add the tomato puree, Kashmiri red chili powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, fennel powder, and cumin powder.  Simmer for 4-5 minutes, covered, over low heat.
Step 6: Add Water and Kasuri Methi: Add water and simmer for another 5-7 minutes. Add coriander leaves and kasuri methi.
Step 7: Add Chicken: Add the tandoori chicken pieces to the gravy. Cover and cook for 6-7 minutes.
Step 8: Final Touches: Stir in salt, chat masala, and heavy cream. Mix well and remove from heat.
Step 9: Garnish and Serve: Garnish with onion rings and coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti or naan.

recipes.name: Classic Butter Chicken
ingredients: 600g chicken breast fillets, trimmed of excess fat and cut into 2cm cubes
directions: Step 1: Heat a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat and spray with olive oil.
Step 2: Add the chopped onion and cook, stirring frequently, for 3-4 minutes until softened and golden brown.
Step 3: Add the tandoori paste and cook, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Step 4: Add the chicken pieces and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 minutes until browned on all sides.
Step 5: Pour in the chopped tomatoes and chicken stock. Stir well to combine.
Step 6: Reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Step 7: Add the chopped cashews and simmer for another 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce starts to thicken.
Step 8: Stir in the yogurt and spinach. Cook for a minute or two until the spinach has wilted.
Step 9: Serve the butter chicken over cooked basmati rice. Garnish with chopped cucumber and fresh coriander leaves.
Step 10: Serve with pappadums on the side.
